message.content: This question requires knowledge about cellular dependency and the ability of certain organisms to function independently. Brewer's yeast, option (A), is a unicellular organism that can survive and function without the help of other cells. It has all the necessary cellular components to carry out vital functions such as metabolism, reproduction, and response to stimuli. Options (B) air, (C) sand, and (D) sugar are all non-living entities and do not exhibit cellular structure or function, therefore they cannot survive without the help of other cells.

To answer this question, we need to understand the concept of organisms that are capable of independent survival. Option (A), Brewer's yeast, is the correct answer because it is a single-celled organism that can survive without the help of other cells. It is capable of carrying out all necessary life processes on its own. Options (B), (C), and (D) are incorrect because they do not meet the criteria of being an organism that can survive without the help of other cells. Air, sand, and sugar are not living organisms and are not capable of independent survival.

This question tests our knowledge of organisms and their ability to survive independently. Brewer's yeast is a type of single-celled organism that is able to survive and reproduce on its own without the help of other cells. Option (B) is incorrect because air is not an organism, but a mixture of gases. Option (C) is incorrect because sand is an inorganic substance and not capable of independent survival. Option (D) is incorrect because sugar is an organic molecule and not a living organism.

To answer this question, we need to understand what it means for an organism to survive without the help of other cells. Brewer's yeast is a single-celled organism that can carry out all of its necessary biological functions independently. It is capable of obtaining nutrients and energy, reproducing, and carrying out other life processes without needing the assistance of other cells. Option (B) is incorrect because air is not an organism and cannot survive on its own. Option (C) is incorrect because sand is an inanimate material and cannot survive. Option (D) is incorrect because sugar is a nutrient source, but it still requires other cells for metabolism and other essential processes. Only Brewer's yeast is capable of surviving independently as a single-celled organism.

This question requires basic knowledge about the ability of organisms to survive independently. Option (B) is incorrect because air is not an organism and does not have cells. Option (C) is incorrect because sand is an inorganic material and does not have cells. Option (D) is incorrect because sugar is a component of food and does not have cells.

Option (A) Brewer's yeast is correct because yeast is a unicellular organism that can survive and perform all necessary functions without the help of other cells. Option (C) sand is incorrect because it is an inanimate substance and not living organism. Option (D) sugar is incorrect because it is a nutrient source for many organisms, but cannot survive or carry out all necessary functions on its own.
